org.microbean.kubernetes.controller

Class AbstractEventDistributor<T extends HasMetadata>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.kubernetes.controller.ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer<T>
      • org.microbean.kubernetes.controller.AbstractEventDistributor<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Consumer<EventQueue<? extends T>>

    public abstract class AbstractEventDistributor<T extends HasMetadata>
extends ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer<T>
    An abstract ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer whose implementations are particularly suitable for supplying to the EventQueueCollection.start(Consumer) method and can distribute Events in some fashion.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    fireEvent(Event), EventQueue, EventQueueCollection.start(Consumer)

      • Fields inherited from class org.microbean.kubernetes.controller.ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractEventDistributor

        protected AbstractEventDistributor(Map<Object,T> knownObjects)
        Creates a new AbstractEventDistributor.
        Parameters:
        knownObjects - a mutable Map of HasMetadata objects indexed by their keys (often a pairing of namespace and name); may be null, but this will result in inaccurate deletion tracking and the inability to keep track of the prior state of resources; if non-null will have its contents changed by this AbstractEventDistributor's ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer.accept(EventQueue) method; if non-null will be synchronized on by this AbstractEventDistributor's ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer.accept(EventQueue) method
        See Also:
        ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer.accept(EventQueue)

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        protected void accept(Event.Type eventType,
                      T priorResource,
                      T resource)
        Implements the ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer.accept(Event.Type, HasMetadata, HasMetadata) method by creating an Event and calling the fireEvent(Event) method with it.
        Specified by:
        accept in class ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer<T extends HasMetadata>
        Parameters:
        eventType - the Event.Type describing the new Event; must not be null
        priorResource - a HasMetadata representing the prior state of the Kubernetes resource the new Event will primarily concern; may be—and often is—null
        resource - a HasMetadata representing a Kubernetes resource; must not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if eventType or resource is null
        See Also:
        ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer.accept(EventQueue), Event.Event(Object, Event.Type, HasMetadata, HasMetadata)

      • fireEvent

        protected abstract void fireEvent(Event<T> event)
        Distributes the supplied Event in some way.

        Implementations of this method should be relatively fast as this method dictates the speed of EventQueue processing.

        Parameters:
        event - the Event to distribute; must not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if event is null
